title: I can't figure out which profile and email folders are correct and needed
content:
I am looking to copy Thunderbird to a new machine but it's not as simple as it should be because I have Thunderbird data in multiple places. From Help/Troubleshooting Profiles, I get:

Default Profile yes Root Directory C:\Users\Randy\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ohig3f3m.default Local Directory C:\Users\Randy\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles\ohig3f3m.default

The root directory is 1.37 Gb The local directory is 8.23 Mb I also have d:\data\thunderbird which is 14.7 Gb. There is no Profiles subfolder here.

The two profiles folders show ohig3f3m.default was updated today. All three folders show files as recent as today.

The file sizes shouldn't be surprising. I have saved emails back to 2007 and I'm a prolific email writer.

I'm guessing that some time years ago, with a much smaller main hard drive, there was an option to save Tbird data to a different location than the default. So I set it to be on my D drive.

So what do I do now? I could copy all three directories to a new machine in the same locations. I think that should work. But is there some way I could or should simplify things, or should I just leave well enough alone.
creator: rbrook1

title: Unable to Add Mail Accounts to Thunderbird
content: UNABLE TO RE-ADD MAIL ACCOUNTS TO THUNDERBIRD For the last three or four months I have been getting two separate messages in the bottom of the screen when opening Thunderbird on my laptop. "GMAIL settings are out of date" and "Yahoo settings are out of date". Then, a about a month ago when I opened Thunderbird I noticed that it was trying to download almost 3000 Gmail emails. I had always believed that only new Gmail messages would download on start up? Whilst this was happening it was impossiblle to do anything on my laptop as I had limited internet access. The only way I could see to stop this was to delete my Gmail account from Thunderbird. When I opened Thunderbird I continued to get the messages "settings are out of date" for each of my mail accounts. So I deleted my email accounts from Thunderbird with the intention of re-adding them. I then downloaded and re-installed Thunderbird to ensure I was on the latest version. I then tried to re-add my mail accounts, letting Thunderbird find and load the correct email settings for each account but I now get an error message saying "Unable to Log In at Server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password". Refer to attached screenshot. I can log in to my Mail Accounts OK using Firefox so I know my username and password are correct. I also tried adding my mail accounts manually in Thunderbird but I contiue to get the same message. I am unable to add my mail accounts to Thunderbird and I have run out of ideas regarding diagnosis and resolution. I need help please.
creator: graeme.hurst16

title: Why the latest Monthly Release channel is not present in the Release Notes page at https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/releases/ ?
content:
Hi,

Thunderbird Desktop is now available in the Monthly Release Channel, with version 136.0 released on March 4th, 2025.

More information about this release is not yet updated in the Release Notes.

Currently, only information about the ESR channel is available in the Release Notes.

title: Thunderbird & Hotmail
content:
Hi, I have just set-up 2 new Hotmail accounts & checked them both etc & both are working perfectly through Outlook. I also have 2 old/existing Hotmail accounts that too are working perfectly through both Outlook & Thunderbird. All accounts are set-up in Thunderbird using POP3 using OAuth2 authentification for both POP3 & SMTP servers. Unfortunately, I am having trouble adding both the 2 new Hotmail accounts to Thunderbird. When adding an account & inputting "Name", "Email Address" & "Password" & then enter I receive the message in a green bar stating "Configuration found in Mozilla ISP database"............brilliant !!! I then select the "POP3" button & hit the box "Done" Normally, all would be accepted to which I would finally click on the box "Finish" & my account would be added. Instead, I now get an error message in a yellow box stating "Unable to log in at srver. Probably wrong configuration, username or password" ? These are 2 new Hotmail accounts I have only JUST set-up. The details entered are all correct & log me into Outlook with no problems & work perfectly sending & receiving. As for "Configuration" I just let Thunderbird set the POP3 settings as done with the 2 old/existing Hotmail accounts which go in perfectly through Thunderbird. Is there something causing this with new hotmail accounts ?

Kind Regards

Geoff
creator: lilfeff
